intro: Mollia paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Mollia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, humid environments and is often found near rivers and in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
